bibl.title: Thomas S. Brown and et al. v. Thomas Jefferson Hamilton. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.ab:
IN THE DISTRICT COURT,
Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the Counties of King and Kitsap.
body.p: The People of the United States of America, to the marshall of Washington Territory Greeting:

We command you, that you have the bodys of Thomas S Brown, G Geods, Geo Downing, Charles Schubard, Carl Jong Matson (known as C.J. Young) + Peter J Wegner by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Thomas S Brown, G Geods, Geo Dowing, Charles Schubard, Carl Jong Matson (known as C.J. Young) + Peter J Wegner shall be called or charged, before the Roger S. Greene HON. R.A. Jones, Judge of the aforesaid Court at the District Court Room, in the city of Seattle W.T. at the hour of two o'clock in the afternoon of the 17th day of October AD 1887 to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Thomas S. Brown G Geods, George Downing, Chas Schubard, Carl Jong Matson (known as C.J. Young) + Peter J Wegner And have you then there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON RICHARD JONES Judge of said District Court, and the seal thereof this 17th day of Oct A.D. 1887 W.E. Ledgerwood, Clerk.
United States of America } ss. Territory of Washington

I T.J. Hamilton U.S. Marshall for Washington Territory do hereby certify that as within commanded, I have now here before the Hon. R.A. Jones, Judge of the within entitled Court the bodies of the within named Thos. S. Brown, G Geod, Geo. Downing, Chas. Schubard, Carl Jong Matson (known as C.J. Young) and Peter J Wegner, amd each of them, together with the time and cause of their imprisonment.
T.J. Hamilton U.S. Marshal by M.L. Hamilton, Deputy
